definition: to meet again after a long period of separation
(long) time/(long) duration of time
surname Bie
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
heavy/serious/to attach importance to
to repeat/repetition/again/re-/classifier: layer
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon

sentences.english: Then they had a little celebration on finding each other.
sentences.chinese: 於是，他們先慶祝了一下久別重逢。

sentences.english: People feel especially drawn to one another when they have been reunited after many years of separation.
Having reunited after a long departure, the two certainly have a lot to talk about.
sentences.chinese: 兩人久別重逢，自有許多話說。

sentences.english: Refers to the long-awaited family and friends or brothers?
sentences.chinese: 指親友或兄弟久別重逢，在一起親切交談。

sentences.english: They were pleased to meet after such a long separation.
sentences.chinese: 久別重逢，他們非常高興。

sentences.english: It was of course a delight for them to meet again after such a long separation.
The reunited lovers rush to a motel.
sentences.chinese: 兩個久別重逢的愛人去了汽車旅館。

definition: lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
separated in life and death/to part for ever
to part forever/eternal parting (i.e. death)
familiarity at first sight
former acquaintance/old friend
lit. don't fight, won't make friends (idiom); an exchange of blows may lead to friendship/no discord, no concord
to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally./It feels like we have known each other all along.
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
to brush past
Cowherd and Weaving maid (characters in folk story)/separated lovers/Altair and Vega (stars)
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
to reminisce/to talk about former times
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
to regard the four corners of the world all as home (idiom)/to feel at home anywhere/to roam about unconstrained/to consider the entire country, or world, to be one's own
love at first sight
